payload.content: Paul Rosolie is a naturalist, explorer, and author of the book "Junglekeeper," dedicated to protecting the Amazon rainforest.

payload.content: The podcast episode features discussions on uncontacted tribes in the Amazon Jungle, intense new encounters, never-before-seen footage of tribe warriors, and the mysteries of the jungle.

name: The podcast episode features discussions on uncontacted tribes in the Amazon Jun
content: The podcast episode features discussions on uncontacted tribes in the Amazon Jungle, intense new encounters, never-before-seen footage of tribe warriors, and the mysteries of the jungle.

payload.content: The podcast episode covers topics such as the tribe's diet (monkeys, turtles, and turtle eggs), Jane Goodall, advice for young people, cartels, narco-traffickers, assassination attempts, climbing giant trees, giant anacondas, rescuing spider monkeys, dangerous animal encounters, writing, journaling, and great writer inspirations.

content: The podcast episode covers topics such as the tribe's diet (monkeys, turtles, and turtle eggs), Jane Goodall, advice for young people, cartels, narco-traffickers, assassination attempts, climbing giant trees, giant anacondas, rescuing spider monkeys, dangerous animal encounters, writing, journaling, and great writer inspirations.
